options: A physical funnel for sales materials
The journey prospects take from awareness to purchase, visualized as stages with decreasing numbers
questions.explanation: A sales funnel maps the customer journey: Awareness → Interest → Consideration → Purchase. Wide at top (many prospects), narrow at bottom (fewer buyers). Each stage needs specific content/actions. Example: Awareness (blog posts), Interest (free guide), Consideration (case studies), Purchase (demo/trial). Optimize each stage to increase conversion rate.

options: A valuable free offer that captures contact information in exchange for value
questions.explanation: A lead magnet is free value exchanged for contact info (email, phone). Types: ebooks, checklists, templates, webinars, free trials, consultations, calculators. Must: (1) Solve specific problem, (2) Deliver quick win, (3) Be relevant to your paid offer. Good lead magnet attracts qualified prospects, not just anyone.

options: A wire that makes people trip
A low-cost, high-value offer that converts leads into buyers, making bigger purchases easier
questions.explanation: A tripwire is a low-friction first purchase ($7-$47) that: (1) Covers ad costs, (2) Turns leads into customers (psychological barrier crossed), (3) Segments serious buyers. Example: Free ebook (lead magnet) → $27 mini-course (tripwire) → $997 full program (core offer). First purchase is hardest; tripwires lower the barrier.

options: Sequential offers of increasing value and price that guide customers from entry to premium products
questions.explanation: A value ladder structures offers from low to high investment: Free content → Lead magnet → Tripwire ($7-$47) → Core offer ($97-$997) → Premium ($1K-$10K) → High-ticket ($10K+). Each rung delivers more value, builds trust, and qualifies buyers for the next level. Maximizes customer lifetime value.

questions.text: What is marketing automation in a funnel?
options: Using software to automatically deliver targeted messages based on user behavior and triggers
questions.explanation: Marketing automation delivers the right message at the right time based on behavior. Examples: (1) Download ebook → trigger email sequence, (2) Abandon cart → send reminder, (3) Purchase course → enroll in upsell sequence. Tools: ActiveCampaign, HubSpot, ConvertKit. Enables personalization at scale - nurture thousands of leads individually.
